and reduce its scope in a few other instances.
Mostly in `CategoryTheory` and `Data` this time; some `Combinatorics` also.

nodes.body: :v: grunweg can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
What is the current guidelines around `variable {α : Type*}` vs `variable {α}`? Is there a preference for one over the other?

I would say that `variable {α : Type*}` is preferred if you want to ensure the variable gets its own fresh universe variable. The problem with `variable {α}` is that, in context, it might specialize the universe metavariable, for example to `{α : Prop}`. The `Type*` prevents that from happening.

Thanks for the careful comments (and the build fix); I have addressed all of them.
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8679422841/job/23798115189)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8679422841/job/23798115060)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8679422841/job/23798115132)
Left a couple comments. I'm assuming we don't want to introduce explicit universes when unnecessary.

There are just a few comments to address, but everything looks good. Once you fix these, feel free to merge.

bors d+
Left a couple comments. I'm assuming we don't want to introduce explicit universes when unnecessary.
I would suggest using `Type*` in place of `Type w` and delete this line.
Same here.
Why is this one necessary?
It wasn't; thanks for prodding me to remove it!

```suggestion
instance {j : ConnectedComponents J} : Category (Component j) :=
```

```suggestion
instance {j : ConnectedComponents J} : Functor.Full (Component.ι j) :=
```

```suggestion
instance {j : ConnectedComponents J} : Functor.Faithful (Component.ι j) :=
```
It should be possible to change `Type u` below to `Type*` and delete this line. (And delete the porting note.)
You should be able to replace `w'` with `w`. This `w'` is unnecessary, afaict.

I believe `v₂` can be replaced by `v`. The porting note on line 323 could probably be fixed. `{D}` just needs to be replaced with `{C : Type u}` (and all following occurrences of `D` get replaced by `C`).

```suggestion
variable {C D : Type*} [Category C] [Category D]
```
`Type w` should be able to be replaced by `Type*`.
Is there a reason for `{u : V}` here?
Same question for `{u v w : V}`.
Should we add a TODO to remove this? A few of the following lemmas feel like they abuse autoImplicits.
The `set_option autoImplicit true` might be a TODO enough. That's how I reviewed all `autoImplicit` motion for this PR.

There's a different reason, I got tired at some point. But I pushed a new commit fixing this; it wasn't so bad after all. :-)

My understanding is that most uses of `autoImplicit` are supposed to be removed; I'm gradually doing so. Feel free to join the effort :-)
I left this as-is since this file doesn't import the `TypeStar` tactic yet (i.e., `Type*` isn't defined yet).
Could be removed and `Type u` replaced with `Type*`
This can also be removed. `induction_on` can use `{a : Sort*}` instead.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: remove autoImplicit from more files

What is the current guidelines around `variable {α : Type*}` vs `variable {α}`? Is there a preference for one over the other?

I would say that `variable {α : Type*}` is preferred if you want to ensure the variable gets its own fresh universe variable. The problem with `variable {α}` is that, in context, it might specialize the universe metavariable, for example to `{α : Prop}`. The `Type*` prevents that from happening.
Left a couple comments. I'm assuming we don't want to introduce explicit universes when unnecessary.

Thanks for the careful comments (and the build fix); I have addressed all of them.
bors r+
